meanings.definition: To serenade or celebrate with a noisy parade or demonstration.
meanings.sent1: The neighbors chivareed the newlyweds with music and cheers.
meanings.sent2: They chivareed the winning team with loud applause and confetti.
meanings.sent3: The town decided to chivareed the mayor with a surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The fans chivareed the star player with chants and banners.
meanings.sent5: The children chivareed their teacher with a song and dance routine.

meanings.definition: A noisy mock serenade to a newlywed couple.
meanings.sent1: The friends prepared a chivareed for the newlyweds with pots and pans.
meanings.sent2: The tradition of a chivareed for the bride and groom dates back many years.
meanings.sent3: The chivareed for the couple turned into a joyful celebration.
meanings.sent4: The neighborhood organized a chivareed for the just-married pair.
meanings.sent5: The loud chivareed woke up the whole street in excitement.

meanings.sent1: The protesters gathered outside the building and chivareed their dissatisfaction.
meanings.sent2: The crowd's chivareed could be heard from blocks away.
meanings.sent3: The chivareed of the audience made the speaker pause in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The chivareed of the fans echoed through the stadium.
meanings.sent5: The chivareed of the students caused the principal to address their concerns.
